ThingDef.label: steel shrooms
ThingDef.description: Toadstools taken from a steel shroom tree, these wonderful waste byproducts may be smelted at an Electric Smelter to make usable steel ore. Eating is highly discouraged (and painful!).

ThingDef.label: plasteel bulb chunks
ThingDef.description: Chunks of broken Plasteel Bulb husk. Plasteel bulb husks contain seeds of plasteel bulbs. The refinement process sees these removed so as to maintain the ability to reproduce the mother bulb. Failure to do so leads to the waste of the potential plasteel anyway, as at high temperature the seeds break down into a compound that reacts with the unique molecular composition of plasteel, destabilizing it. Remaining Plasteel Bulb Chunks may be refined at an Electric Smelter into plasteel ore.

ThingDef.label: gold fern leaves
ThingDef.description: Mature fronds of the Gold Fern. Indistinguishable from gold, with identical properties, these amazing fronds may be smelted at an Electric Smelter into gold ore.

ThingDef.label: jade crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline leaves of a Jade Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of jade that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: silver flower petals
ThingDef.description: The petals of the silver flower must be cautiously pulled from the harvested stem, which is laden with thorns. The petals themselves are razor sharp, with a nasty tendency to leave a portion of themselves behind in a cut. Once separated from the chaff, the petals may be smelted at an Electric Smelter into usable silver.

ThingDef.label: uranium root bulbs
ThingDef.description: Bulbs taken from a uranium root plant. Pellets of protected uranium coated by minerals and plant fiber. Safe to handle, play with, and even eat. (Please don't, indigestible.) May be smelted into usable uranium at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: bioferrite leafs
ThingDef.description: Smelt into bioferrite.

ThingDef.label: ceramite bulbs
ThingDef.description: Harvesting the bulbs of the ceramite flower, Once separated from the chaff, the bulbs may be smelted at an Electric Smelter into usable ceramite.

ThingDef.label: adamantium bulbs plant bulbs
ThingDef.description: Bulbs taken from a adamantium plant. May be smelted into usable uranium at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: amethyst crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a amethyst Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of amethyst that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Chalcedony crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Chalcedony Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Chalcedony that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Citrine crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Citrine Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Citrine that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Diamond crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Diamond Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Diamond that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Emerald crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Emerald Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Emerald that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Garnet crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Garnet Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Garnet that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Lapis crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Lapis Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Lapis that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Quartz crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Quartz Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Quartz that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Ruby crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Ruby Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Ruby that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Sapphire crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Sapphire Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Sapphire that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Serpentine crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Serpentine Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Serpentine that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Turquoise crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Turquoise Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Turquoise that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Diamond crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Diamond Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Diamond that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Ruby crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Ruby Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Ruby that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: Sapphire crystal
ThingDef.description: Crystalline crystals of a Sapphire Crystal. Suspended within photosynthetic fluid are particles of Sapphire that may be extracted at an Electric Smelter.

ThingDef.label: agave fruit
ThingDef.description: Raw agave fruit.

ThingDef.label: berries
ThingDef.description: Assorted berries. Nice to eat, even when raw.

ThingDef.label: apples
ThingDef.description: A red fruit grow on trees.

ThingDef.label: banana
ThingDef.description: A yellow fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: grapes
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on vines.

ThingDef.label: orange
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: peach
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: pineapple
ThingDef.description: A tropical fruit having large swordlike leaves and a large, fleshy, edible, multiple fruit with a terminal tuft of leaves.

ThingDef.label: blueberry
ThingDef.description: Blue colored berry that grows in bushes. Even good raw.

ThingDef.label: watermelon
ThingDef.description: A large, roundish or elongated fruit of a trailing vine having a hard, green rind and a sweet, juicy, usually pink or red pulp.

ThingDef.label: date
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: fig
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: gooseberry
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on vines.

ThingDef.label: cloudberry
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on vines.

ThingDef.label: Cherries
ThingDef.description: A red berry fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: Coconut
ThingDef.description: A coconut fruit that grows on trees. Has a hard outer shell with a juicy fruit flesh inside.

ThingDef.label: bamboo
ThingDef.description: fast growing grass used for construction.

ThingDef.label: Ironwood
ThingDef.description: Ironwood is stronger and more beautiful then normal wood. Useful for building structures, weapons, and even simple prosthetics. Very beautiful decorative material.

ThingDef.label: honey
ThingDef.description: Super sweet, super delicious, honey is used as a natural sweetener in all sorts of goodies. Also used in the production of mead. Doesn't spoil, though can deteriorate if left outside.

ThingDef.label: honey mead
ThingDef.description: Mead can taste good, but its main effect is intoxication. Excessive consumption can lead to alcohol blackouts and, over time, addiction.

ThingDef.label: red lentil
ThingDef.description: Raw protein-rich lentil. Used in place of meat in recipes.

ThingDef.label: mushroom
ThingDef.description: Raw protein-rich mushrooms. Nice to eat, even when raw.

ThingDef.label: garden fish
ThingDef.description: Fresh water small fish. Normally caught in shallow waters.

ThingDef.label: snow beet
ThingDef.description: Raw snow beet.

ThingDef.label: barley
ThingDef.description: Cereal grain used for livestock feed, cooked for food, and used for beer making.

ThingDef.label: bean
ThingDef.description: Common bean cooked up in many ways.

ThingDef.label: Olive
ThingDef.description: A small berry fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: cactus fruit
ThingDef.description: Raw cactus fruit.

ThingDef.label: coffee beans
ThingDef.description: Raw Coffee. Best prepared as a beverage

ThingDef.label: tea leaves
ThingDef.description: Tea leaves for brewing.

ThingDef.label: silage
ThingDef.description: Nutrient-rich fermented hay and grains for your animals. The fermentation process preserves the silage preventing rot.

ThingDef.label: biofuel
ThingDef.description: Fuel made from the processes of refining various types of plants for oils and alcohols. And is used to fuel generators and workbenches.

ThingDef.label: Hive piece
ThingDef.description: A living piece of an insect hive. Used to make a hydro-jelly farm to produce insect jelly. Eww I think it's still moving...

ThingDef.label: Garden Tea
ThingDef.description: A drink made from brew tea leaves.

ThingDef.label: Barley Tea
ThingDef.description: A drink made from brewed barley. \n\nDrink Effects: Blood Filtration.

ThingDef.label: Garden Coffee
ThingDef.description: A cup of coffee

ThingDef.label: fruit juice drink
ThingDef.description: A drink made from pressing fruit for their juice. \n\nDrink Effects: Consciousness and Blood Filtration.

ThingDef.label: chocolate milk
ThingDef.description: Chocolate added to milk.

ThingDef.Name: MealbowlstewBase
ThingDef.description: A bowl of slow cooking stew. \n\nFood Effects: Consciousness, Metabolism, Blood Filtration, and Blood Pumping.

ThingDef.label: stir-fry meal
ThingDef.description: Cooking technique in which variety of ingredients are fried in a small amount of very hot oil. \n\nFood Effects: Manipulation and Blood Filtration.

ThingDef.label: vegetarian stir-fry meal
ThingDef.description: Cooking technique in which vegetarian ingredients are fried in a small amount of very hot oil. \n\nFood Effects: Manipulation and Blood Filtration.
A complex dish assembled with care from vegetarian ingredients.

ThingDef.label: carnivore stir-fry meal
ThingDef.description: Cooking technique in which meat ingredients are fried in a small amount of very hot oil. \n\nFood Effects: Manipulation and Blood Filtration.

ThingDef.label: Hardtack
ThingDef.description: A simple type of biscuit. Tastes bland, but not offensive. Made from grains. It lasts a very long time without refrigeration. Great for travelling.

ThingDef.label: bamboomaker dryad
ThingDef.description: A slow, bumbling caste of dryad which specializes in bamboo production. Together with its Gauranlen tree, this dryad can generate a bamboo-like material on an ongoing basis. However, it is slow and ineffective at work or combat.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Gauranlen tree. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

ThingDef.label: ironwoodmaker dryad
ThingDef.description: A slow, bumbling caste of dryad which specializes in ironwood production. Together with its Gauranlen tree, this dryad can generate a ironwood-like material on an ongoing basis. However, it is slow and ineffective at work or combat.\n\nIn general, dryads are mammal-like creatures that have a symbiotic relationship with the Gauranlen tree. They reproduce together with their tree, which contains a hidden dryad queen. Dryads can morph into various specialized castes.

ThingDef.label: bamboo bonsai pot
ThingDef.description: This special pot is suitable for planting bamboo bonsai trees, which can improve the mood of people nearby and satisfy ideoligious requirements.

ThingDef.label: bonsai bamboo
ThingDef.description: A small bamboo tree, pruned and shaped to look visually pleasing.

ThingDef.label: pumpkin
ThingDef.description: Large orange version of the squash plant. Often carved to ward off ghosts.

ThingDef.label: squash
ThingDef.description: Yellow variety of the squash family.

ThingDef.label: blue corn
ThingDef.description: Raw blue corn.

ThingDef.label: bean
ThingDef.description: Common bean cooked up in many ways.

ThingDef.label: tomatoes
ThingDef.description: A sharp-tasting fruit that has many uses.

ThingDef.label: red lentil
ThingDef.description: Raw protein-rich lentil. Used in place of meat in recipes.

ThingDef.label: apples
ThingDef.description: A red fruit grow on trees.

ThingDef.label: peach
ThingDef.description: A sweet fruit that grows on trees.

ThingDef.label: Soylent Green
ThingDef.description: Soylent Green - made from "High Energy Plankton".

ThingDef.label: Soylent Blue
ThingDef.description: Soylent Blue - made from Animal Meat.

ThingDef.label: Soylent Purple
ThingDef.description: Soylent Purple - made from Insect Meat.

ThingDef.label: Soylent Red
ThingDef.description: Soylent Red - made from Plants.

ThingDef.label: Soylent Yellow
ThingDef.description: Soylent Yellow - made from Animal Products.

ThingDef.label: eggplant
ThingDef.description: Purple variety of the eggplant. Bitter when eaten raw.

ThingDef.label: pumpkin
ThingDef.description: Large orange version of the squash plant. Often carved to ward off ghosts.

ThingDef.label: squash
ThingDef.description: Yellow variety of the squash family.

ThingDef.label: tomatoes
ThingDef.description: A sharp-tasting fruit that has many uses.

ThingDef.label: carrots
ThingDef.description: Crunchy vegetable with a refreshing taste. May help you see in the dark.

ThingDef.label: kiwi
ThingDef.description: An edible berry that is oval about the size of a large hen's egg and has a fibrous, dull greenish-brown skin and bright green or golden flesh with rows of tiny, black, edible seeds. The fruit has a soft texture with a sweet and unique flavour.

ThingDef.label: mango
ThingDef.description: A juicy stone fruit from tropical trees. The fruits may be somewhat round, oval, or kidney-shaped. It's skin is leather-like, waxy, smooth, and fragrant, with color ranging from green to yellow, yellow-orange, yellow-red, or blushed with various shades of red, pink or yellow when fully ripe.

ThingDef.label: avocado
ThingDef.description: The avocado fruit is a single-seeded berry with a tough skin. It is a pear-shaped fruit and has a large central seed.

ThingDef.label: guacamole
ThingDef.description: A simple meal quickly from Avocado and Tomato.

ThingDef.label: Compost Starter
ThingDef.description: Compost starter is use to make fertilizer which enhances the soil and speeds up the growth of plants.

ThingDef.label: Fertilizer
ThingDef.description: Fertilizers enhance the soil and speeds up the growth of plants.

ThingDef.label: Pile of dirt
ThingDef.description: Simple soil dug out of the ground at a digging spot. Used to make fertilizer.

ThingDef.label: dandelion tea
ThingDef.description: A fragrant tea infused with leaves of the dandelion plant. Drinking it induces a mild boosted immunity effect. This tea is easy to produce at cooking facilities.\n\nMany tribes use dandelion tea as part of social and religious rituals.

ThingDef.label: antibiotics
ThingDef.description: A drink made from fruit and medicine to aid in recovery from sickness. Lasts for 4 days.

ThingDef.label: De-Worm
ThingDef.description: A drug for preventing parasites and worms before they take hold. Blocks gut worms and muscle parasites. Must be taken every five days to remain effective.\n\nThis drug only prevents new parasites. It does not cure existing parasites - even those that are not yet discovered.

ThingDef.label: Flu Ez
ThingDef.description: A drug for blocking flu. Works on animals. Take every five days. \n\nMakes 2.

ThingDef.label: Ibuprofen
ThingDef.description: A drug for blocking pain. Take every day.

ThingDef.label: Mecha-Gone
ThingDef.description: A drug for preventing mechanites before they take hold. Blocks fibrous and sensory mechanites. Must be taken every 5 days to remain effective.\n\nThis drug only prevents new infections. It does not cure existing infections - even those that are not yet discovered.

ThingDef.label: tobacco
ThingDef.description: Raw tobacco. Not recommended for eating, but makes for a nice smoke

ThingDef.label: Cigarillos
ThingDef.description: A pack of cigarillos

ThingDef.label: glitterworld inoculation
ThingDef.description:
A power glitterworld drug for preventing most infections before they take hold. 

Blocks malaria, sleeping sickness, plague, infections, gut worms, muscle parasites, flu, fibrous and sensory mechanites. Must be taken every 15 days to remain effective.

This drug only prevents new infections. It does not cure existing infections - even those that are not yet discovered.

ThingDef.label: Neutro Flower Petals
ThingDef.description: Beautiful Yellow-Orange Petals from the Neutro Flower. Used to make Neutroamine, a medicine base.

ThingDef.label: alyssum trimings
ThingDef.description: Beautiful Alyssum trimings from the Alyssum Flower. Used to make Glitterworld neutroamine, a drug and medicine base.

ThingDef.label: glitterworld neutroamine
ThingDef.description: A synthetic precursor chemical. While it is useless on its own, many drugs require glitterworld neutroamine as an ingredient.

ThingDef.label: Bandage Kit
ThingDef.description: A pack of bandages made from cloth. Less potent than medical kits.

ThingDef.label: dandelion cuttings
ThingDef.description: The cuttings from the dandelion flower. Can be used in cooking or made into a healthy medicinal tea.

ThingDef.label: baked polenta
ThingDef.description: Polenta that has been baked into a bread.

ThingDef.label: bread
ThingDef.description: A very simple baked good. Since thousands of years humans bake and eat these tasty loafs.

ThingDef.label: sweet bun
ThingDef.description: A sweet roll covered in sugary icing.

ThingDef.label: muffin
ThingDef.description:
A sweet baked muffin made with fruit. 

Food Effects: Well Fed: Baked Good. 

 Increased Consciousness and Metabolism

ThingDef.label: Fruit Pie Slice
ThingDef.description:
A slice of pie. 

Food Effects: Well Fed: Baked Good. 

 Increased Consciousness and Metabolism

ThingDef.label: cookie
ThingDef.description:
Fresh baked cookies! 

Food Effects: Well Fed: Baked Good. 

 Increased Consciousness and Metabolism

ThingDef.label: pizza
ThingDef.description:
Pizza in 30 minutes or less! 

Food Effects: Well Fed: Baked Good. 

 Increased Consciousness and Metabolism

ThingDef.label: Grilled Vegetables
ThingDef.description: Vegetables that have been cooked over a grill.

ThingDef.label: Grilled Steak
ThingDef.description: Meat that has been cooked over a grill.

ThingDef.label: meat pie
ThingDef.description: A simple baked pie with a filling of meat. \n\nFood Effects: BloodPumping.

ThingDef.label: grilled polenta
ThingDef.description: A loaf of Potenta that has been sliced and grilled to perfection. \n\nFood Effects: Manipulation and Metabolism.

ThingDef.label: Porridge
ThingDef.description: A simple porridge cooked from grains. \n\nFood Effects: BloodPumping.

ThingDef.label: grilled cheese sandwich
ThingDef.description: Two slices of bread grilled with cheese melt in the middle. \n\nFood Effects: BloodPumping.

ThingDef.label: Grilled Kabob
ThingDef.description: Meats and Vegetables skewered on a stick and grilled to perfection. \n\nFood Effects: Metabolism and Manipulation.

ThingDef.label: Cheese Burger
ThingDef.description: Two slices of bread with grilled meat and cheese melt. \n\nFood Effects: Metabolism and Manipulation.

ThingDef.label: Tacos
ThingDef.description: Meat and Cheese in a Corn shell. \n\nFood Effects: Metabolism and Manipulation.

ThingDef.label: salted meat
ThingDef.description: Meat that has been cured with salt.

ThingDef.label: Pickled Vegetable
ThingDef.description: Vegetables that have been preserved in a salty brine.

ThingDef.label: sugarcane
ThingDef.description: Harvested canes from the sugar-cane plant.

ThingDef.label: cheese
ThingDef.description: A block of cheese.

ThingDef.label: wheat
ThingDef.description: Wheat is a cereal grain, for milling into Flour.

ThingDef.label: Dried Fruit
ThingDef.description: Fruit the has had the water removed.

ThingDef.label: Vegan Egg Substitute
ThingDef.description: Vegan Egg Substitute is a egg shape product made from tofu, potato, or banana. Used in place of eggs in baking and other recipes.

ThingDef.label: flour
ThingDef.description: Simple flour, used in baking.

ThingDef.label: Maki roll
ThingDef.description: A Rolled dish of cold cooked rice served with a garnish of raw fish, vegetables, or egg. \n\nFood Effects: Metabolism and Manipulation.

ThingDef.label: Nigiri
ThingDef.description: A small ball of rice topped with raw fish or other seafood. \n\nFood Effects: BloodPumping.

ThingDef.label: yogurt
ThingDef.description: A sweet treat made from milk. \n\nFood Effects: Moving and Blood Pumping.

ThingDef.label: ice cream
ThingDef.description: A sweet frozen treat made from milk. \n\nFood Effects: Moving and Blood Pumping.

ThingDef.label: smoothie
ThingDef.description: A sweet drink made from fruit and milk. \n\nFood Effects: Moving and Blood Pumping.

ThingDef.label: Caramel
ThingDef.description: A sweet candy made from sugar and milk. \n\nFood Effects: Moving.

ThingDef.label: Hardcandy
ThingDef.description: A hard candy made from sugar and fruit juice. \n\nFood Effects: Moving.

ThingDef.label: Taffy
ThingDef.description: A chewy sweet candy made from sugar and fruit juices. \n\nFood Effects: Moving.

ThingDef.label: tofu
ThingDef.description: Raw protein-rich Tofu. Made from Beans. Nice to eat, even when raw.

ThingDef.label: salt
ThingDef.description: Salt is used into preservation of foods.

ThingDef.label: cotton fibre
ThingDef.description: Raw cotton. It can be spun into cloth or sold to a trader.

ThingDef.label: Raw flax
ThingDef.description: Raw flax. It can be spun into cloth or sold to a trader.

ThingDef.label: Raw devilstrand
ThingDef.description: Raw devilstrand. It can be spun into cloth or sold to a trader.

ThingDef.label: Plasteel Thread
ThingDef.description: Thread spun from melted plasteel used in advanced cloth production.

ThingDef.label: Hemp
ThingDef.description: Cloth woven from the stuff those guys are smoking who decided that wearing this was a good idea?.

ThingDef.label: Linen Cloth
ThingDef.description: A fabric designed for making clothes. It is soft, light, and strong.

ThingDef.label: blended wool
ThingDef.description: Soft, light and provides very good insulation. Wool clothes can keep the body warm even in extreme conditions.
